hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Panic
hypothesis_content.statement: When major negative news triggers a sharp liquidity withdrawal (bid-ask spread widening > 150% of 7-day average) in a NEUTRAL regime, mean reversion occurs within 48 hours as opportunistic liquidity providers refill the gap, creating a short-term buying opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent 'structural shift' narrative suggests market makers are quicker to withdraw during stress but also quicker to return when panic subsides. NEUTRAL regimes lack strong directional bias, making liquidity restoration more predictable than in BEAR/STRESS regimes.
entry_conditions: Entry: 2 hours after spread peak confirmation

exit_conditions.take_profit: Spread returns to within 20% of 7-day average OR price rebounds 3% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Spread continues widening beyond 2x 7-day average OR price drops 5% from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If spread remains elevated >48 hours or continues widening despite neutral regime, indicating permanent liquidity impairment rather than temporary gap.
